decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient spells to power out Arclight Phoenixes from the graveyard, enabling aggressive and explosive plays. It includes a mix of card draw, removal, and evasion to support the Phoenix plan, with cards like Treasure Cruise and Consider helping to cycle through the deck quickly. The key strategy is to use spells like Lightning Axe and Fiery Impulse to fill the graveyard with Phoenixes, then bring them back for repeated attacks with the help of cards like Picklock Prankster and Sleight of Hand.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on using cheap spells and creatures to quickly apply pressure to the opponent. It combines burn spells like Reckless Rage and Torch the Tower with creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage to deal damage efficiently. Academic Dispute and Stormchaser's Talent can help maintain card advantage and push through damage. The deck aims to finish off opponents quickly and efficiently while maintaining a steady stream of threats. The inclusion of cards like Cori-Steel Cutter and Den of the Bugbear provide additional options for closing out games.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Ouroboroid. The deck also utilizes powerful cards like Archon of Emeria and Skyclave Apparition to control the board and tempo. Collected Company allows for explosive plays by putting multiple creatures onto the battlefield at once. Elspeth, Storm Slayer provides a powerful finisher if the game goes long. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost spells and creatures. The deck focuses on utilizing cheap spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to control the board while creatures like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear chip away at the opponent's life total. The deck also features cards like Academic Dispute and Stormchaser's Talent to draw cards and maintain momentum. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced, aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with instants and sorceries to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard for repeated aggressive attacks. It uses cheap spells and card draw to enable this strategy, while also including disruptive elements like Lightning Axe and Picklock Prankster to control the board and protect key pieces. The mana base is designed to support the deck's low-curve and enable consistent access to both red and blue mana sources. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and efficient spells.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to opponents using cheap, aggressive creatures like Emberheart Challenger, Soul-Scar Mage, and Monastery Swiftspear. The deck also includes spells like Reckless Rage and Monstrous Rage to control the board and clear the way for attackers. The goal is to overwhelm opponents with a fast and efficient offensive strategy, utilizing cards like Academic Dispute and Stormchaser's Talent to maintain card advantage and tempo throughout the game. The combination of direct damage spells and evasive threats makes this deck a powerful and flexible aggressive option in Pioneer 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the battlefield using low-cost spells and creatures, such as Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear. The deck focuses on dealing damage quickly and efficiently, while also disrupting the opponent with cards like Reckless Rage and Boomerang Basics. Utilizing a mix of burn spells, creatures with prowess abilities, and land disruption, the deck aims to maintain pressure and tempo throughout the game, ultimately overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

This control deck focuses on utilizing Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to maximize its potential. The deck includes a combination of counterspells like Dovin's Veto, powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, and board wipes like Supreme Verdict to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes card draw with Memory Deluge and tempo plays with Field of Ruin. With strong removal options and a focus on controlling the battlefield, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in a slower, more controlling Pioneer format.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and hand using cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while also utilizing cards like Blade of the Oni and Preacher of the Schism to apply pressure. The mana base is designed to support the Orzhov color combination and the inclusion of Godless Shrine and Mutavault helps with mana fixing and providing additional threats. The deck's win condition comes from cards like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Pest Control, aiming to outvalue the opponent in the long game.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent with efficient and aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Soul-Scar Mage, and Cori-Steel Cutter. The deck also includes burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to control the board and finish off the opponent. By leveraging card draw with spells like Academic Dispute and Consider, the deck aims to maintain tempo and overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. The mana base is designed to support a fast and consistent aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a combination of low-cost creatures and removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By efficiently utilizing cards like Knight-Errant of Eos, Venerated Loxodon, and Warden of the Inner Sky, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early on and maintain board control throughout the game. With a mix of creatures, removal, and support cards like Portable Hole, the deck is well-rounded and versatile, allowing for different strategies and approaches to secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with instants and sorceries to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard for repeatable attacks. It also includes efficient card draw and removal spells to keep up the pressure on opponents. The key strategy is to be aggressive and constantly bring back Arclight Phoenix to overwhelm the opponent with fast, repetitive damage. Additionally, the deck includes some disruptive elements like Spell Pierce and Picklock Prankster to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain board control.

The primary strategy of this UW Control deck is to stall the game with counter spells, removal, and card draw until you can take control of the board with powerful threats like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Elspeth, Storm Slayer. The deck also focuses on manipulating the opponent's deck with cards like Get Lost and No More Lies, while using cards like Fountainport and Floodfarm Verge to ensure you have the mana to cast your spells. Additionally, the companion Kaheera, the Orphanguard provides additional value and synergy with your creatures.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Badgermole Cub and Gwenna, Eyes of Gaea. It also utilizes ramp with cards like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic to quickly cast powerful threats such as Overlord of the Balemurk and Acererak the Archlich. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, while also having some removal options like Abrupt Decay to deal with opposing threats. It's a deck that prioritizes board presence and tempo to secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this deck is to use a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells to apply early pressure on the opponent while limiting their ability to cast spells. By playing proactive threats like Archon of Emeria and Skyclave Apparition, as well as disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, the deck aims to quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize. Collected Company provides additional flexibility and card advantage, while Elspeth, Storm Slayer serves as a powerful finisher. The mana base is optimized to support the aggressive game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of counter spells, removal, and card advantage. The deck also utilizes the companion mechanic to provide additional value. It aims to maintain a strong defense with cards like Supreme Verdict and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, while also creating opportunities to win the game through incremental advantage and card advantage. By efficiently managing resources and disrupting the opponent's plans, this deck seeks to outlast and outmaneuver opponents in the Pioneer 1 vs 1 format.
